My overall reaction to finally watching Guardians of the Galaxy: Footloose references on point.
@LoriBrister @fictionaljules @acava Of course! Let me think about it some more and I'll send more suggestions :)
@fictionaljules @acava si exciting! The inca trail is one of the best hiking experiences! Cuzco & Lima are amazing - incredible food
@jalbacutler @colsonwhitehead I've been anxious to read it! I'm already obsessed with Zone One. This might be new obsession!
Que tristeza! #JuanGabriel was the sound of my childhood, watching Sabado Sensacional & learning about music. https://t.co/7JaliDWFcX
@randyjontiveros the tv show or movie?
@fictionaljules @acava @ewpittman @LoriBrister This looks awesome!
@ewpittman Thank you! That's the dream! :)
@ewpittman _Juan_'s a re-imagination of _Shaun of the Dead_ There's a good chpt "Slacker Bites Back" in the edt collection _Better Off Dead_
@ewpittman Awesome! It's *very* funny but will need some contextualizing about Castro dictatorship and US-Cuban relations
@ewpittman There's also a self-published novel by Ismael Galvan _Blubber Island_ which has a few zombies in it and it's hilarious
@ewpittman Not technically zombies, but they're cannibals and you could present them as such?
@ewpittman I love both of those! White Zombie is also great. I also found this: https://t.co/pHoqL1IiH7. There's also _Somos lo qui hay_
@ewpittman It also depends how you want to define "zombie" There are other sources that don't technically fall under category but could work
@ewpittman yes! I love Juan of the Dead (set in Cuba) Díaz "Monstro" &George Romero is Cuban-American (which people don't really talk about)
No joke: amidst the lunacy of presidential elections, Grace & Frankie is the best thing that could ever happen! https://t.co/lc81uKLbEa
Olympics start this week! Who has a TV and wants me to sit on their couch for 2 weeks while intermittently clapping & crying? Any takers?
@Stranger_Things Is *so* good. 80s nostalgia, solid sci-fi, mystery, sweet soundtrack. What else could anyone want?
